Articles.Content: I am tone121, i just bought KSP on steam. I am a new beginner, any tips i need to know for building a rocket?

Welcome to the universe of Kerbal Space Program!

I highly recommend using the Kerbal Engineer Redux mod, it's just completely invaluable for junior rocket scientists like me. That way you can keep track of your TWR and dV easily.

Pointy bit at the top, hot bit at the bottom?

[/helpful]

Seriously though, just start slapping a few bit together and see what happens. Check out the wiki and Scott Manley's videos on Youtube. Starting out in Career Mode and getting it right using only a few different parts is a good way to learn.

KER as mentioned above is one of the more useful mods, combined with one of the ÃŽâ€v maps it can tell you if your rocket has enough smash to reach your destination. First challenge is kind of the biggest: you need about 4500ms-1 to make orbit.

Start out simple with a one Kerbal capsule, parachute, decoupler, FL-T800 fuel can, and a LV-30 engine. Learn how to fly it sub orbital. Then go two stage. Upper, a FL-T400 with some OX-stat panels and a LV-909, decoupler, FL-T400 and FL-T800, with LV-30 or LV-45, and learn how to orbit and return.
